meanings.definition: A written or printed copy of a manuscript or document.
meanings.sent1: I made a typescript of my essay to hand in to the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The typescript of the novel was neatly bound and ready for publishing.
meanings.sent3: The typescript of the recipe book was so messy, it looked like a scribble contest winner.
meanings.sent4: Her typescript of emotions spilled onto the page like a colorful painting.
meanings.sent5: The typescript of the speech was so clear, it felt like the speaker was in the room.

meanings.definition: A document or piece of writing produced by typing or word processing.
meanings.sent1: She saved the typescript of the report on her computer for future reference.
meanings.sent2: The typescript of the letter was printed on official letterhead.
meanings.sent3: The typescript of the email was so formal, it seemed like a royal decree.
meanings.sent4: His typescript of ideas flowed seamlessly from one paragraph to the next.
meanings.sent5: The typescript of the contract was so detailed, it left no room for confusion.
